column5: Last weekend I headed out to camp for a few nights. Saturday we never got on the water til 1 or so do to some technical difficulties encountered the previous evening.  Fished without action until about 4pm. All the sudden there was a frenzy of hits on set lines...a few hook ups and losses.  Seemed like a school of smaller fish nibbling on the minnow tails. This kept up for about an hour.  Packing up I saw my gad pop and at a speed only coors can provoke I was off.  Took almost 10mins to handline this fish in on 6lb test. It took a solid group effort with people holding the line off the ice to keep it untangled and an excellent arm down the hole landing job.     9lb 14oz on the digi   Funny thing is went back to the same spot the next evening and the girlfriend hooked into one the same size or bigger that we never got in. Plus it broke my rod.   Good weekend with some mild weather to be out on the ice.
Nicely done, Jay!
Thats a beauty laker for those waters. Just imagine the age of that fish......if only he could talk eh!!  Sinker
thats a gorgeous laker!  Good Job!

A fine grey trout there.  Congratulations on landing such a fine laker on a 6 lb handline.  If you had called it a 10 pounder, only the idiots would have called you on it, it's got length and girth.  Well done.
Nice fish! Nothing beats hand bombing on light line.
Congrats on that real fine laker.
good work on hand bombin that big boy on 6lb nice looking fish, where abouts is camp?
That is one sweeeeet fish.
Sweet laker jay!!
That is one of the nicest Lakers posted this season, well done.  Clarence
Thanks for the replys. I can't wait to get back out there.  Camp is just north of echo bay  (east of the Soo).
Nice fish buddy!
some beautie country up that way, can be a pain in the   to have to hike into some of those lakes but breathtaking none the less,    good work once again  Matt!
where is your camp? on lonely lake? i have 2 buddys with camps on there and they always do well.
great fish.
AWESOME looking healthy laker right there love the colors !!!  good job landing the beast!
Now thats a gorgeous laker if i've ever seen one...
What are the odds!  I have family on Lonely Lake.
Im on McCarrels just a bit up the road from Lonely. I only fished Lonely once and got a solid skunking for my efforts.
Beauty catch! Sounds like a great day after all!
The exciting thing is that i am having my wedding / reception / dinner / party on that lake this fall.  hey jay, do you think she'll still marry me if we go out fishing the day of my wedding?
Great report and pic troutologist  That is one beautiful laker.... congratulations You must of got a good rush of adrenaline fighting this beast!!  Again great job and thanks for sharing Leechman
Good stuff!  Pretty fish for sure  must have been Fun   don't yah just love this fishin thing we do?  Check Ice   Cheers  Paul
